lexUnit.name: despise.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: feel contempt or repugnance for.

sentence.text: It 's become a truism that we despise ageing in this culture , and I see few signs of that abating .
He does n't want people he despises buying his gear for conversation pieces . "
She despised him for an affair that had begun and ended thirty years before .
She went , despising herself for her eagerness and unable to contain it , and watched the charismatic and social side of Jack at work with his colleagues .
Despising herself for her weakness she reached for the telephone , dialling Nick 's number .
Against her creamy paleness his hand was a thin brown intruder , and he knew there were times when she despised him for his swarthy colouring .
She might despise him for the methods he used in business , but the fact remained that she loved him , and if there was anything she could do to protect him she would do it .
Alix could not have afforded this solution , and would have thought it cheating had she been able to afford it , although she thoroughly despised herself for these scruples .
He despised himself for this and consequently admired Elsie all the more .
He had long forgotten how he had despised the old man for being mean and ignorant .
Nigel told Eleanor that he despised her for making a pass at him .
Gustave despised Du Camp for wanting the LÃ©gion d'honneur .
Most despise Mr Milosevic as a former communist , but find themselves agreeing with him on the Vance-Owen plan .
But he had despised her husband from the beginning .
At the time , after all , we despised the manner in which our elders were so nostalgic for the hippy era .
But the Muslims , though they despise Syrian rule in Lebanon , need Syria 's presence to ensure that real political reform takes place .
Lord John had hoped that his friend would accompany him , but he sensed how much Manvell despised him for so easily surrendering to Sharpe 's threat .
It was as painful as hell , and she despised herself for even caring what he had thought of Mark 's abilities , but for some reason she desperately needed to know .
He scorned them as a man of action must despise all faint-hearts .

Scarlet despised her methods , as she knew Clarissa would despise hers , for Scarlet agitated herself only about the nutritional content of food and held in contempt the misplaced aestheticism of the lily-contoured table napkin .
So you do n't despise money , really -- do you ? "
We were ignored and despised by everyone -- fans , venues , bands and journalists .
The Persian Empire , then , was not uniformly hated or despised by Greek writers .
Black sheep was often despised by shepherds , and their wool was less valuable .
He is therefore to be hated and despised .
True , Rupert had proposed the match , and sent envoys a full year previously to treat for Blanche 's hand , and the alliance was not one to be despised .
Except in Catalonia , the lower ranges of the legal profession were despised -- in the Basque Provinces lawyers were debarred from participation in the local assemblies .
` How could anyone despise a country which gave us the Renaissance , Venice , Michelangelo ? "
He despised the rural ignoramuses who did not even know the system .
He despises the method actors .
They may despise the lower strata whose members may well find such behaviour offensive .
Indeed , he despised those who gave him counsel .
Richard Branson symbolised everything he despised ; the world of upper-middle-class , public-school , breadroll-throwing , cultural philistinism .
Even if some of them come for what others hold to be a wrong reason , they should not be discouraged or their motives despised .
